Source Documentation¶

Shopware.Client¶

class Shopware.Client.Client(*args)¶

Interface to a shopware shop’s API

Parameters:
  • endpoint – Endpoint of your shopware API, e.g. http://www.myshop/api
  • user – Your backend user name
  • key – Your API key, configured for each backend user
create(ressource, data, params={})¶

Create a ressource

Parameters:
  • ressource –

    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:

    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • data – The data array for your ressource
  • params – Additional params to append to the request URL
delete(ressource, id, useNumberAsId=False)¶

Delete an object

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Id of an object to delete
  • useNumberAsId –

    Optional: If set, the API is told not to search for the specified object by its primary ID, but by its human readable number.

    There might be some limitations: Your will not be able to delete articles this way, as articles itself are not identified by a number: The article details (main detail, variants) are identified by numbers. In order to prevend accidental delition of a whole article when only a variant was to be deleted, articles cannot be deleted by number.
deleteByNumber(ressource, id)¶

Convenience method to delete a given ressource by its number

Same as calling delete(ressource, id, useNumberAsId=True)

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Id of an object to delete
read(ressource, id=None, params={})¶

Read a ressource

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Optional: If set, only the specified object will be feteched
  • params – Additional params to append to the request URL
readByNumber(ressource, id)¶

Convenience method to read a given ressource by its number

Same as calling read(ressource, id, useNumberAsId=True)

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Id of an object to read
update(ressource, id, data, params={})¶

Update a given ressource

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Id of an object to update
  • params – Additional params to append to the request URL
updateByNumber(ressource, id, data)¶

Convenience method to update a given ressource by its number.

Same as calling update(ressource, id, data, useNumberAsId=True)

Parameters:
  • ressource –
    Any existing API ressource. Default Shopware ressource are:
    • articles
    • customers
    • categories
    • media
    • variants
    • orders

    As the shopware API can be extended by plugins, any of those ressource might work as well

  • id – Id of an object to update

Shopware.Request¶

exception Shopware.Request.Error¶

Base error class for the API

class Shopware.Request.Request(endpoint, user, key)¶

The Request class handled the REST logic

Usually there is no need to have an instance of this class other than Shopware.Client().

constructUrl(ressource, id=None, params=[])¶

Constructs a url from the known endpoint, the given ressource and the given params

Parameters:
  • ressource – The api ressource
  • params – List of additional HTTP params
Returns:

The desired url as string
exception Shopware.Request.StatusError(status, response, content)¶

General status error
